conclusion: To determine the heat exchange Q, analyze the PV diagram and apply the first law of thermodynamics.
First law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
In a cyclic process, ΔU = 0, so Q = W.
Process A→B: Pressure P_A = P_B = 1 x 10^5 Pa, Volume V_A = 3 L to V_B = 4 L.
Work done in A→B: W_AB = 100 J.
Heat exchange in A→B: Q_AB = 100 J.
Process B→C: Volume V_B = V_C = 4 L, Pressure P_B = 1 x 10^5 Pa to P_C = 0.75 x 10^5 Pa.
Heat exchange in B→C: Q_BC = ΔU_BC = nC_VΔT_BC.
Process C→D: Pressure P_C = P_D = 0.75 x 10^5 Pa, Volume V_C = 4 L to V_D = 3 L.
Work done in C→D: W_CD = -75 J.
Heat exchange in C→D: Q_CD = -75 J.
Process D→A: Volume V_D = V_A = 3 L, Pressure P_D = 0.75 x 10^5 Pa to P_A = 1 x 10^5 Pa.
Heat exchange in D→A: Q_DA = ΔU_DA = nC_VΔT_DA.
Total heat exchange: Q_total = Q_AB + Q_BC + Q_CD + Q_DA.
